person.persName: James A. Hardie (Clarke County, Washington, Adjutant General and Inspector General (U.S.A))

body.p: Clarke County, Washington Barracks, Adjutant General and Inspector General (U.S.A). New York native. Married Margaret Hunter Hardie in St. Louis, Missouri on March 8, 1851. Father of Frank Hardie, Margaret Hardie, Joseph Hardie, and Autha Hardie. Attended Western Collegiate Institute in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania c.1835. Attended the Poughkeepsie Collegiate School in New York c.1837. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in West Point, New York in 1843. Served as Major of First New York Volunteers in San Francisco, California during Mexican War between 1846 and 1848. First Lieutenant United States Artillery in Jefferson Barracks, St. Louis, Missouri in 1850. Promoted to Captain in 1857. Captain in United States Army in Clarke County, Washington in 1860. Appointed Adjutant General of Department of Oregon (U.S.A.) in 1861. Served as Lieutenant Colonel and Aide-de-camp to General George B. McClellan in 1862. Appointed Major and Assistant Adjutant General in regular service (U.S.A.) in February 1863. Promoted to Colonel and Inspector General in March 1864. Brevet promotion of Brigadier and Major General of United States Army in March 1865.
